website_summaries.verdict: An excellent value for what you get, but not everyone enjoys the sweetness.
pros: Dissolves easily without clumping – no blender needed
Great price for the amount you get
cons: Stick to the unflavored powder if you're trying to avoid sugar and artificial sweeteners

customer_reviews.title: Made Difference in Height of Keto Dinner Rolls; 22 mo. Expiration; Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this whey powder for use as an ingredient in a Keto almond flour roll recipe. Boy, did the rolls bake higher than they did when I used 1/4 c. Almond or Coconut Flour as one of the ingredients when making the recipe. I know nut flours don't have the gluten necessary to rise, but the rolls I made did come out taller when I removed them from the oven. Purchased this on 5/21/18; expires 3/2020. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mmctec

customer_reviews.title: although it does have a teeny tiny flavor it's nothing that would make something else that you add it to taste bad. I love to add this to stews or ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about this really being "unflavored"....although it does have a teeny tiny flavor it's nothing that would make something else that you add it to taste bad. I love to add this to stews or soups to thicken them because as a gastric bypass patient I'm not to supposed to eat soups, they are considered a " slider food"- something that passes through your system to fast to get any nutrients out of it, and this prevents that from happening. I also add it to my iced coffee to make a meal out of it. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Love the unflavored protein powder so much I had to buy the 3 pound one. Got the unflavored one mainly because it makes it multipurpose to use via cooking or shakes. When I powders the bigger 3 LB one they really pack it to the top. You get your money’s worth. I would recomend to those not sure what flavor to try the smaller bag first. P.s. the scoop in the big one is a little buried from the top.
customer_reviews.author: April R.

customer_reviews.title: Does not dissolve.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t dissolve. I’ve tried hot and cold liquids and it turns into one solid mass. Then I’ve tried shaking and stirring and it helps a little but ultimately I end up having to strain it and about 1/2 of the scoop is thrown in the trash. It really is flavorless though, if you can get past the chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good product, frothy and has a milk flavor
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my trainer. I chose unflavored so I could pick the flavor of my choice without competing flavors. It says it has no flavor, but it does it takes like milk. It is very foamy which I didn’t expect but it is fine once you get used to it. You can use a shaker which really makes it frothy or you can use a blender if you want to add frozen fruit or ice. If you use a blender do not fill it to the top because this acts like yeast and rises so fill three quarters.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Mix it in cold
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting ready for bypass surgery. This was recommended at my support group. It was suggested that I can mix it with bullion or mix in my my water or juice Etc. I discovered that it must be mixed in cold liquid in order to avoid chunks. It doesn't say that anywhere on the package I repeat anywhere I read it thoroughly. I don't think it tastes too badly but my kids disagree. But I may be alone in that. You tend to convince yourself of something when you have to you know you eat would you have to eat kind of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Reay Clan

customer_reviews.title: Best I've tried yet
customer_reviews.text: Great price and product. Why pay more for the flashier brands? 100 calories and 25mg of pure protein. I bought the unflavored, I love that it's truly tasteless, odorless, and dissolves easily. Perfect for shakes and I was pleasantly surprised with the packaging. I live in FL, the sunburn state so I was a little worried about this product in the heat. I actually picked it up in the afternoon the day after it was delivered and the package wasn't even warm. Awesome buy all around, I'll definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Used for protein intake WLS
customer_reviews.text: ****** I am 2weeks post GASTRIC BYPAS Used twice. 1. With cream of wheat. 2. With cream of mushroom soup. Had explosive diarrhea stool wthin 1 hour of consumption.
customer_reviews.author: OLIVIA

customer_reviews.title: SOLID MASS IN HOT LIQUIDS
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT dissolve in hot coffee!! It turned to a SOLID rubbery like mass. I tried a hand blender to break it up but choked on the now hard crumbed pieces. Wasted a whole scoop! I does however dissolve in a cold beverage with just shaking it. I don’t mind the very slight aftertaste. Wish this work in hot things :(
customer_reviews.author: Sean N.

customer_reviews.title: Used for baking almond flour bread
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order this product again because I ordered the vanilla flavor isopure to use as a protein shake and make ice cream. It had a very obvious disgusting salty metallic taste. I wanted to make a keto bread recipe and with the amount of almond flour, I needed as low carb as possible, so I tried the unflavored. This powder and "bread" is by FAR the best "bread" I have EVER made in all the years I've been keto. This is definitely going on the repeat order list.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Usher

customer_reviews.title: Not unflavored--simply bad flavored.
customer_reviews.text: I understand it was to be unflavored but it's not. It has this horrid burnt milk taste from the processing that I could not cover with Espresso & stevia; peppermint extract; vanilla & nutmeg.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Best unflavored protein you can buy! Add it to baked goods!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best unflavored whey protein! The 3 lb option is the best price option also. It comes recommended by bodybuilding.com as the most recommended unflavored protein.You can hide it in anything from a shake to pancakes, to cornbread muffins. I find a scoop or two in just about any baking recipe works great, but if you need help figuring out recipes you can find dozens on the Isopure website.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: It's like a bowl of frosted flakes
customer_reviews.text: It's like a bowl of frosted flakes... Grrrrrrrreat! A lot of people seem to buy this Unflavored protein with the wrong expectations... it's UNFLAVORED, meaning none of the artificial flavors and food colors were added. Unflavored is different from TASTELESS, which is what a lot of people seem to expect. It has taste, it's natural taste, it's just not flavored like chocolate etc. Hope that clears it up some. Offers a good boost of protein (Scores 1 on the PDCAAS scale) added to any shake without really altering the flavor. It kind of tastes like malt. Mix in a scoop of real cinnamon and some ice cubes and you get a delicious frosty. Part of my daily regimen.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: I've had better.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be OK but it smells like sour milk but tastes fine. Tastes just like any other unflavored protein I have purchased in the past. The only difference is sometimes my shake will have little bits in it. Kind of like tiny pieces of plastic or kind of like coconut flour bits. The tiny bits don't have any flavor and may just be parts of the protein that haven't been filtered out properly like the higher end brands. From reading other reviews I just might have received a fake container. Either way I am probably going to look at other options.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not Suitable for Hot use
customer_reviews.text: Even though the package specifically states, “Easy to mix into your preferred flavored beverages (HOT or cold), SOUPS, sauces, and baked good recipes.” This was not the case at all. I tried adding to soup twice and both times the powder congealed into an almost rubber like substance. I love other Isopure products but this one is a bust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the taste and didn't blend easily. Won't purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great for fruit smoothies
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the protein shakes or smoothies that were prescribed by a nutritionist for my partner. Much better than the flavored protein powders, which seem to add a chemical flavor, this seems undetectable and dissolves fully. Adding it to fruit (frozen or fresh), plant based milk, a little plain Greek yogurt, ice cubes, some vanilla flavoring and sometimes a little sweetener like xylitol (or sugar or honey or ??), the last two depending on the taste of the fruit. Mix it up in a nutribullet blender, and voila. Something palatable that makes me look good and makes him happy!
customer_reviews.author: Gardening Girl

customer_reviews.title: Ugh.
customer_reviews.text: For something that is "unflavored" - this is gross. Can't get it down without gagging.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Foam or not??
customer_reviews.text: Isopure is best unflavored whey that I've found. Simple, clean ingredients and virtually no flavor. I mix a scoop with my milk tea and it's perfect. No blending or clumping problems. The ONLY reason I dropped a star is because I've found differences between batches. Typically, when I mix, my drink gets really foamy. I don't mind it, just scoop of a bit off the top and it tastes fine. But this latest pouch, despite the same mixing habits, doesn't foam at all. The inconsistency makes me nervous. But so far, no digestive issues or any real negatives with the non-foaming. Poll: Do you get foam when you mix your drink???
customer_reviews.author: Love-Faith-Hope

customer_reviews.title: Healthy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the unflavored selection because of its benefits, but it isn't tasteless. It has a slightly unpleasant taste, but if you drink it fairly quickly it won't be as bad. The smell isn't great either. It's whey, so clearly it'll taste and smell, but it's not unbearable. I just can't drink it daily. It's better if you pair it with something else, like another food group in the side, or maybe add something to it. I just wanted the nutrition, so I'm satisfied. I wish it tasted better, or was truly tasteless and odorless. I'd give it less stars if it weren't for the nutritional benefit!!
customer_reviews.author: Mirela B.

customer_reviews.title: Has a flavor- beware
customer_reviews.text: I got this to add a bit more protein to my current morning shake. I thought that it would be unflavored- it is not. Tastes like sweet milk- gross. I am not a fan of milk at all, ruined my morning shake. If anyone out there is interested for reference: I do chocolate pea protein, a scoop of collagen and a cup of frozen strawberries. Which was delicious. Then I added a scoop of this. Had to choke it down. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes amazing shakes. I use a scoop or 2 of the zero carb protein powder, with cocoa powder, dash of vanilla, ice, heavy cream, avocado oil and a no-carb sweetener, blend it up and its the perfect way to negate a sugar/chocolate craving. It tastes like the best chocolate protein shake except it has more of the fat macros I need and way less ingredients than you can find on a packaged protein shake.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W

customer_reviews.title: Seemed so great on paper...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this but unfortunately I don’t. I was looking for a protein powder with no extra anything. I wanted to add it to a shake and not mess anything up, just add protein. This one looked like it fit the bill in ever way. BUT... it give both my wife and I serious heartburn. I rarely rarely get heartburn but I get it every time from this stuff even with a reduced amount. So disappointed! I’m not sure what to do with the rest of it...
customer_reviews.author: Lois J. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Works great in Yogurt
customer_reviews.text: I think a lot of people expect this to have no flavor - that is not the case. It doesn't have any added flavor, but it has a taste, and it's not very good. I'm not sure what others expected, but it takes like I expected. I add this to a plain Greek yogurt and muesli to make a decent breakfast, and it mixes in perfectly. It doesn't taste great, but it's not awful. Overall it's perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Moreno II

customer_reviews.title: Super versatile protein powder, great for keto
customer_reviews.text: I'm on keto and use this for breading fried foods or for bread/pizza substitutes. It has zero flavor so it's easy to add to things where you just want extra protein or if you want a filler with zero carbs. I mix this with grated parmesan to make a coating to make fried chicken and it comes out nice and crunchy without any weird flavors. Great value for the amount you get and the powder is very fine so it's easy to blend with other ingredients or add to a drink.
customer_reviews.author: Hazeldazel

customer_reviews.title: Good product bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's not a bad deal just expect to have some issues. I got it at a great price though. It's a good product however it takes more effort than normal to mix. So mixing takes more effort to mix without big clumps. The packing is terrible, so once I opened it I had to transfer into another container. The ziplock was not properly secured in all of the bags I received. So the ziplock was worthless. Thankfully I was able to move them to a large ziplock I got from Walmart as a temporary solution. As stated before it's not a bad product just expect more some issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Great for drinks, cooking, and baking!
customer_reviews.text: The unflavored whey protein from Isopure has been a wonderful addition to my Keto kitchen. It blends well in liquids for making protein shakes - just add your own flavoring such as greek yogurt, berries, veggies, or extracts. It mixes well in both sweet and savory foods for an added protein boost. I've mixed it in with scrambled eggs, with gravies and sauces, even used it as a coating for grain/gluten free crispy fried chicken, fish, etc... It can add protein and structure to your keto baked goods without altering the flavor. Overall a solid product and great addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Sugar

customer_reviews.title: Still Trying To Figure Out How To Avoid Lumps
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product several times now and feel qualified to comment on it. I like the Isopure shakes a lot. They mix easily and don't taste chalky. However, I have trouble getting the unflavored protein powder to mix well with other ingredients. It doesn't 5aste bad, but I end up with lumps of protein powder in my recipes. I've tried adding liquid a little at a time to make a paste, then blending in the rest of the liquid. I don't know. I like the idea of adding it to recipes, and it doesn't taste chalky. But the lumps are not pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Frying!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this as a flour substitute for frying chicken and I’ll never use another protein powder. It’s crunchy and delicious ✌️ Protein powder is not just for shakes! This is an incredible low carb substitute for flour and breading.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, the packaging is the foil with zip lock. If you get powder in the zip lock area good luck sealing it. You have to dig your hand to find the scoop and it gets messy every time you need to use it. How about a long handled scoop? Beyond the packaging the product blends up well, doesn't really have a taste that I can discern so all is good with the more important part. Customer service - asked for a sample of other type of product, said they would send it and never did. Guess they don't want me as a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Victor E

customer_reviews.title: Great price, content, and tasteless -  but needs a blender
customer_reviews.text: OK so I was spoiled for awhile with a more expensive powder that blended super well - even in plain coffee with a spoon - and it was tasteless. The taste of this one is absent (no I’ve not tried it in water - who does that?) and I love the price and the no carb/high protein content. You MUST use a blender, ninja, something to mix it though. I am going to use this in my smoothies or on the rare occasions I feel like using my ninja in the morning for my coffee. Would work great with bulletproof type coffee concoctions.
customer_reviews.author: Citizenjane

customer_reviews.title: Unflavored, super fine, a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: I love this unflavored stuff. It’s a bit pricier than most, but it’s super finely textured and mixes easily, and can be flavored with whatever you want. Or nothing at all; since it’s just plain protein powder it doesn’t taste too bad. Still tastes like typical whey protein, but there’s no getting around that. Almost 3 eggs worth of protein per scoop, great before or after workout. For keto dieters, this stuff makes a downright delicious “breading” substitute for fried items.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product for diabetics
customer_reviews.text: Great product for diabetics (type 2) like me. After using, I don't really see a significant blood sugar increase after several tests. A great way to add bulk to your diet. The flavor is plain but you can taste a little bit of whey, umami like flavor if you really concentrated your taste buds. But overall great product, you can mix with fruits or yogurt. Mixing with protein shaker easily mixes powder. If you even stir with just a spoon with cold milk, it mixes fairly well with small clumps. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Yuta Da Cray

customer_reviews.title: Like this powder
customer_reviews.text: I really like this protein powder I am not a fitness buff I'm an older woman who is also overweight I use this in my oatmeal every morning and it gives me the up by need to work in a busy fast food restaurant. I also make peanut butter and oatmeal energy bites for my son who does snow plowing and I use this protien powder in them and it gets him through a long long day of plowing
customer_reviews.author: Karen Wallin

customer_reviews.title: Good but contains SOY Lecithin
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly & as described. Overall, I believe this is a good alternative, however, I am returning the product because I noticed that it contains SOY Lecithin; I prefer Sunflower Lecithin, and if the vendor re-creates this same product using sunflower lecithin, and without any soy, or soy byproducts, I will definitely purchase again! For now, I'll just stock up on my usual go to product.
customer_reviews.author: SimplyMe

customer_reviews.title: "Flavorless" but not tasteless.
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews before I purchased this and most say this protein powder is fine but I wholeheartedly disagree. The taste is too overbearing for me and leaves an awful aftertaste. It tastes like spoiled milk left out in the sun for five days. Even mixed in a variety of food, nothing can mask it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. Easy label to read, quality ingredients. I don't feel like I need to get a degree in nutrition to make sense of the label. I'm getting tired of everything being so complicated --- I like the taste and just mix with water, using a blender ball but I am not a person with a sweet tooth. I find many protein powders whether they be natural sugar or sugar substitutes way too sweet for my liking. This stuff can be added to my smoothie if I choose and not compromise flavor or need any adjustment of other contents (fruits etc.) to control the sweet load.
customer_reviews.author: My2Cents

customer_reviews.title: So gross!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I mixed this in milk and it made the drink taste like sour milk. Literally worst taste I’ve ever had in my mouth. Tried mixing it with veggie/fruit smoothie and I could still taste a funk. I know it’s unflavored but is unflavored supposed to taste sour/spoiled?? Steer clear unless any of this appeals to you.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Protein for the lactose-intolerant
customer_reviews.text: I mix 1/2 to 2/3 scoop in my morning oatmeal. (Almond milk is nearly protein-free.) I'm severely lactose-intolerant, but I have no problems with Isopure powder. And I'm aware of an effective protein boost throughout the morning. The powder mixes in fairly well. The powder by itself is smelly. But I don't notice it after I add other ingredients (including a banana and some berries.) I just ordered a refill.
customer_reviews.author: Tzedek

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I blended mine with tea, it does have a little bit of a milky flavor but not bad, it also foams up a little, it did dissolve all the way but it took awhile. I recently had bariatric surgery and have to drink lots of protein but all the premade ones make me sick after a few sips. So far I have drank have a glass and am not nauseous, can't wait to try it in other stuff. Update I am trying it in a pea soup, it was harder to dissolve but it finally did, made the liquid a little foamy and has a slight milky taste.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy marshall

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the other brand!
customer_reviews.text: For starters, the scoop size is 4x the size of the scoop in the other brand. Plus this has more calories and less protein. And unfortunately, it has a slight flavor that I find very off-putting. I'll use what I have but will not order more.
customer_reviews.author: MeadowlarkMT

customer_reviews.title: Truly flavorless and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: So great for making my keto baked goods! I strive to ALWAYS have this product in my cabinet! And you cannot beat this price anywhere you look! This powder is flavorless. I make keto breads with it, made keto cakes and even a tempura batter with it this year for christmas! Versatile is an understatement!
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Taste bad, big scoop, bad at mixing
customer_reviews.text: I tried Isopure as a cheaper way to get my protein instead of buying my usual, which is Genepro. Isopure was and is awful compared to Genepro. It is a huge scoop of powder, has a terrible after-taste, and does not mix well at all. I used 2 scoops out of the bag and haven't touched it since. Definitely spend the extra money and go with Genepro!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Decker

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get your protein.
customer_reviews.text: This protein powder is suppose to be unflavored but I can taste the powder. I think I used to much the first time I used it. It is a great way to get your protein in. Another great tool in my WL journey
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Whey isolate is whey isolate so look for the best value
customer_reviews.text: One of the more economically priced whey isolate products although if you are a regular whey user this size will disappear quickly. I only purchased the small 1 lb size because I was moving . My advice is to buy 5 lb or larger sizes for better economy. As with most whey products, somewhat lumpy when mixed with a spoon. I use a small battery powered hand mixer that blends it smoothly. Unflavored.
customer_reviews.author: GMakTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best unflavored keto protein powder
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for reasonably priced low carb protein powder and this one has the most protein (25g per scoop) per serving at 0g carbs I’ve seen on Amazon. One bag has lasted me approximately two weeks. It is truly unflavored- it’s great to bake with and mix into desserts with. I use it to make chia seed pudding and it doesn’t to anything to the taste or texture. I’ve also tried to mix it in soup with ok results.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Chai

customer_reviews.title: So many ways to eat more protein!
customer_reviews.text: Regular protein powder is usually too sweet for me so I picked this one to mix with my own smoothie. It blends pretty well in my blender with other fruits. I also put this in other food like omelet, pancakes or even soup. It makes food taste bit dry but i still enjoy it so much. If you taste the powder, it taste like non fat milk powder. However, yiu cannot taste it when you mix it with other food. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Maru

customer_reviews.title: UNFLAVORED = YUCK
customer_reviews.text: This is my first protein powder I've ever bought, but this is disgusting. DO NOT GET THE UNFLAVORED powder!!! I bought the unflavored kind so I could blend it into mutiple flavored things. The reviews about it having the smell and taste of baby's milk are correct! I have an entire bag to use and I have no clue how I will use it in order to get my money's worth. TL;DR: DO NOT BUY UNFLAVORED the taste is disgusting 😖
customer_reviews.author: Shay H.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like unflavored whey protein
customer_reviews.text: Mixes well into liquid but I personally couldn’t get over the flavor, which is approximately like spoilt milk or buttermilk watered down. If you mix your shakes with fruit or peanut butter or really anything other than plain water, the flavor is basically unnoticeable. I also found the ziplock bag packaging messy and inconvenient, jars are much easier.
customer_reviews.author: universick

customer_reviews.title: Smelly!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the bag I actually gagged from the smell. I gave it my best shot mixing it into several things. It did mix well, no grit, but I just can't get past the smell. Unfortunately, I bought 2 bags. I even had my daughter try some and she agreed, the only way to get it down is by plugging your nose.
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Upping the protein
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this version of protein powder for over a year. I highly recommend it as an addition to your baking. I make protein waffles with this powder. I add it to my flour. It does not have flavor so therefore it doesn’t take away from the taste of them. It is a bit gritty when added. I have also made my protein shakes with it and have added two table spoons of PB2 chocolate. I have tried drinking it plain, I wouldn’t recommend. In order to make your baking item less gritty I would tell you to sift it. Yeah you can sift it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Limardo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Keto "Breading"
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically to use as a low carb coating/breading and it works really well to provide a crispy texture to fried foods. Definitely is flavorless and you can add whatever is needed to season the meal you're making.
customer_reviews.author: sramspam

customer_reviews.title: Truly unflavored, good mixing
customer_reviews.text: Great product -blends well, and its flavor doesn't show through when mixed with other ingredients. Since it's whey protein, it does have a slight dairy flavor of its own, but it's only noticeable if you eat a spoonful of the powder by itself. In a smoothie you don't taste it. The powder is completely unsweetened, so it doesn't sweeten the finished food at all. This is a great additive to keep you feeling full!
customer_reviews.author: fiberman

customer_reviews.title: Flavor is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Do not assume that unflavored means flavorless. The only way I got this down was to mix it with the least amount of liquid possible and slam it back. Mixing it in anything just made a larger amount of awful taste to drink. That said, I've never liked any whey products but at least I was able to push through in the past. The product mixed very well and I'm sure it's good protein. I didn't use it long enough to determine any physical effects. This bag will probably expire mostly full in the back of my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon eickman

customer_reviews.title: Only one that you like it's really hard to avoid that whey taste
customer_reviews.text: This product has s awsome ! I've always had trouble with protein drinks. Only one that you like it's really hard to avoid that whey taste . This product delivers with no flavor does not affect what you're drinking or you mix it into and it's the easiest product I've ever had to dissolve into whatever it is I'm mixing . it with it never clumps !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MARGARET GUNZELMAN

customer_reviews.title: Great for protein smoothies. Huge fan!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Isopure unflavored protein powder to make my post work out smoothies for the past 2 years. I don't like sugars in protein powder so this is perfect for my taste. Tip - If you are using a blender to make smoothies, blend the fruits/veggies first, then add the protein powder. This powder will increase the volume of the smoothie while blending it, so always add it at the end.
customer_reviews.author: Nitin

customer_reviews.title: Great for pre and post workout!
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for a protein powder without a ton of artificial sweeteners, "natural" flavors, and colors for a while. I read some positive reviews in one of my fitness magazines, and some reviews on Amazon and decided to give this a try. I'm very pleased! No flavor. Blends easily. I'm thrilled to be able to control exactly how my smoothies taste, level of sweetness, and total carbs in my mixed product. Tastes great with a spoonful of organic peanut butter, banana, a handful of berries, and half a cup of oats in a Greek yogurt base. Doesn't upset my stomach like products with sucralose do.
customer_reviews.author: James Bitar

customer_reviews.title: Found it: No sweeteners!
customer_reviews.text: Isopure Unflavored is my dream product. Except for maple syrup, I don't like things that are sweet. The unflavored version contains only two ingredients: no sugar, stevia, monkfruit, or sucralose. It mixes into water amazingly easily. I purchased it to add to baked goods, but I love being able to drink it just mixed with water when I need to kick up my protein numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Ros

customer_reviews.title: I dislike the flavor in water
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the flavor. There are other unflavored protein powders that taste better, such as the Nectar brand and Doc Hale. Update: I should have clarified that for my purposes, I'm just trying to add protein to water without altering the taste too much. For other purposes, this is a fine protein supplement, if you mix it with juice, smoothies or in baking perhaps (I haven't tried baking).
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Protein Powder - Doesn't mix well
customer_reviews.text: So I've noticed that if you make smoothies and drink them immediately this is a decent protein powder. But and this is a big BUT, if you decide to wait more than 30 mins such as refrigerating it overnight for a morning smoothie you will not be able to drink as it will solidify and develop some sort of weird taste. I wanted to like this powder but it just isn't the quality I expected coming from Dymatize powders. I understand that is a much more expensive powder and coming from that brand, others will be sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: Papayaman

customer_reviews.title: Strong stale milk odor and taste! Ick.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this product based on all of the positive reviews, but I was very disappointed. This product is supposed to be “flavorless” based on its advertising, and while I did expect SOME flavor, this product has an overpowering stale milk smell and taste. I mixed this powder with 4 different food items including applesauce, pudding, soup, and a fruit smoothie. I smelled and tasted this product so strongly in the food that I had to throw it out because it didn’t taste good. It was also lumpy when trying to blend it and I had to put it in the blender which then almost liquified the meal. Money and food wasted. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t mix easily in hot drinks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mix in my moms coffee to help her gain weight. I did not want it for blending in shakes or baking. The mix would not dissolve no matter how much stirring or waiting we did. It became foamy and the bits that didn’t dissolve were a very grainy texture. I tried to spoon most of it out, but ultimately sipping the coffee it felt like there was sand in it. I would not buy again as it does not mix easily in hot drinks. Going to give away. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: Not Unflavored - but close!
customer_reviews.text: This protein powder claims to be unflavored, and I’m not sure if I believe that is even possible, but it DOES have a slightly milky taste in my smoothies. I only use it in smoothies, never in a shaker bottle or anything so I cannot attest to that. It is not really a bad or strong flavor, and if I make a smoothie with banana in it than the flavor of the protein is completely lost. Overall I am happy with this and will continue using it until it is gone, however I may look for a different brand after that.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Geer

customer_reviews.title: Weird but very slight taste.  It was fine.
customer_reviews.text: It’s kinda gross. Neither super thick or super thin but on the thin side. Pretty much tasteless but for the vaguest taste of old milk. You pretty much would have a really hard time drinking it straight with water... maybe in say almond milk or something. Mixes well. I ended up cutting it 1/2 and 1/2 with another protein powder to use it. Couldn’t take it by itself and I’ll eat about anything. It is fairly filling and I used it as an after workout drink. But it’s Kinda rough on it’s own.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Get it.
customer_reviews.text: I put this in everything. Want to learn to incorporate in even more food. Saw someone on here use it for fried chicken batter. I’ve used it in stews, yogurt, salad dressing. Flavor is not that noticeable but yes depending on what you mix it with you will notice a subtle difference from what it normally tastes like. Take it from a dancer who hates protein shakes...get this
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Misia

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you, this stuff is disgusting. It claims it's 'flavorless' but has a horrible after taste. I honestly don't know how it has so many good reviews. It's very suspicious. My husband tried it first because he was looking for a new protein supplement and gagged. I tried it afterwards and had to wash it down with a bottle of water. Gross.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Everything is perfect except of the price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't understand why was it cheaper to buy a bag of 1lb rather than a 3lb tub. Some weird pricing strategy there. Still, I am going to try out other brands of unflavored shake to see how it reacts on the stomatch and see if I can get a substitute. ISOPURE is among the best brands out there, but the price is pretty high for my spending capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: TASTES LIKE NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! It tastes like nothing, which is exactly what I want from a protein powder that isn't suped up with tons of sugars and mass gainers. This protein powder is plain and simple protein for people that need protein but are trying to lose weight. And it tastes like nothing, so when you ad your fruit or veggies or peanut butter (whatever), it will just taste like those items. I'd highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: TheFurnitureGuy

customer_reviews.title: Keto Friendly for fried chicken
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for fried chicken flour while on Keto. It doesn't taste the same but it's very light and you still get that crunch. I actually used an air fryer and set it on 390 (but probably better at 375 so the drumsticks will cook more inside) and sprayed the chicken with EVOO after coating it to make sure the flour cooks. Very Important.
customer_reviews.author: Jade A.

customer_reviews.title: Taste like dairy products
customer_reviews.text: This is not unflavored! I mixed this with spinach, mango and coconut water (my typical quick and easy smoothie) and decided i needed to increase my protein. I was thinking any minimal flavor would be masked by the mango, but i was wrong. I couldn’t even drink it, it was so gross!! I might try it again with cocoa to hide the weird “dairy” flavor because I hate to waste it, but I haven’t been desperate enough yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K.

customer_reviews.title: This product mixes well if what you are mixing it in is not to hot.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product! I bought this to use while I had to prepare for my weight loss surgery and could not eat solid foods but still had to get protein. I found those chocolate milk type protein drinks to sweet and hard for me to drink I didn't have that problem with Isopure it truly has no flavor, funny smell or any weird texture. I was able to mix it with anything I wanted as long as the temperature was not hotter than 144 on my instant-read thermometer. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: chris hardin

customer_reviews.title: Good value protein , horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Overall the blending of the protein was good, and it digested without any noticeable problems compared to other whey proteins. The packaging however is truly awful and unusable by design. My pack came with the tear able plastic fully intact and no evidence of tampering, but upon tearing it is when the biggest flaw became apparent. The closing tabs are all clumped up with protein powder and makes the packaging unable to close . So you'd need another container to store the protein in it, and for me the scoop was buried in the middle of the bag so I had to dig for it .
customer_reviews.author: kevin pang

customer_reviews.title: Great on Salad
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand the taste of this powder as a drink but I know when I need protein, I need protein. It may sound weird but I like this in my salads. It doesn't add any nasty flavor and the texture is like cheese. It works out when I only need half a scoop or so to meet my protein goals.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Use daily in my coffee - love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily in my morning cup of black coffee. I let the coffee cool down a bit. It blends super well. I am a bariatric patient & this allows me to meet my daily protein goals. Allows me to start my day off with 25g of protein & minimal calories. It doesn't change the taste of my coffee, rather it just makes it creamy. Thank you Isopure!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Jones

customer_reviews.title: The flavorless protein powder you’ve been searching for.
customer_reviews.text: I drink this quickly with just water for a protein boost or in a shake if I want more flavor. It’s so flavorless, it almost absorbs other flavors. It has a HINT of the gross flavor you get from almost all whey (not isolate) powders but is manageable. I appreciate the lack of basically anything (carb/fat/sugar) than protein. Doesn’t make me sick like whey does when I pound a shake like I’m a man dying of thirst in the desert does water.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Ultra lean protein, taste is so so, pricey
customer_reviews.text: This is about as lean protein as is possible. Taste, as expected, is not great but at least it's bland enough that you can mix it with other things. Main downside of this product is the cost, which is more than double the price of protein isolate from online direct brands like My Protein.
customer_reviews.author: Prime4Value

customer_reviews.title: Expect FLOATIES
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in June, 2018. It does not have a taste to me, but it does not dissolve well. It has tiny bits floating in both hot and cold products. My friend gave me a sample of Genepro- it dissolved INSTANTLY! I’m switching, because the little floated feel weird when drinking them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi H.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product. I had stopped using whey protein & ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. I had stopped using whey protein & plant based powders for several years. They all just gave me GI upset of some kind no matter what brand. I saw this pop up in my amazon recommendations after watching a video on keto fudge with whey in it. So, after reading the description I thought what the heck I will give this one a try. I was not disappointed! It is wonderful and my body loves it.
customer_reviews.author: UneBelleFemme

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Nausea!! Hello Muscle!
customer_reviews.text: I ALWAYS had issues with protein powders. They would make me nauseous and feel really heavy in my stomach. It would be a very uncomfortable part of my work out, the flavors wouldn’t help, actually I think the flavors were what made it overwhelming! I tried every flavor outhere! Banana, chocolate, vanilla, cookies and cream you name it UNTIL I came across this one!! Ugh life saver! No nausea, no heavy iron flavor! I LOVE IT! You won’t even know it’s in your shake!!
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Smooth no clumps
customer_reviews.text: I'm doing my 2 week post op surgery diet at first I wanted to cry because it was awful but then I added a sugar free Carmel and other syrups and it's much better now. It blends well so it's smooth. I prefer unflavored because you can add the flavor you want yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Aida M. Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an unflavored powder that tastes like nothing
customer_reviews.text: Every day, I despair at the state of the humanity. Why on Earth do people love fake sugar and weird artificial flavors in their protein powder? I'm not drinking this because I enjoy protein powder. No amount of fancy scientists are ever going to make low-calorie protein shakes taste like a double mocha latte with extra whip and 2400 calories. It's like a race to the bottom where we do unspeakable things to food and pretend our transgressi
customer_reviews.author: J. Tetreault

customer_reviews.title: Blends well but bitter taste
customer_reviews.text: The protein powder does what it says and foams when blended. It is “unflavored” in a sense that it’s not sweetened therefore has a bitter whey taste to it. The first time I blended one scoop into my strawberry banana smoothie (no sweetener added) and it was kind of bitter. I would definitely suggest adding sweeteners to the shake to cover the bitterness and taste of whey (I used ovaltine since that’s what I had). But this is all expected.
customer_reviews.author: OliviaZ

customer_reviews.title: NOT UNFLAVORED
customer_reviews.text: Although it does not have a horrible taste is is not unflavored. Will not mix with anything that is even slightly warm. I read reviews that said it mixed fine with warm liquids so I was hoping to add it to my coffee. HUGE mistake. I ended up with a lumpy, gross cup of coffee that I poured down the drain. I do mix this with already made protein drinks to add extra protein. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL

customer_reviews.title: Isoprene unflavored protein powder
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time buyer of this brand. This product mixes great in a shaker bottle. I use it for my coffee. I will be using it with baking and cooking. The only thing I did not like is the bag does not seal back up. No big deal. Just put it in another container. This has no after taste. It has no taste. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this....
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. I had the gastric sleeve Monday and wanted to add it to the liquids I’d be drinking. It’s clumpy and doesn’t dissolve and it does have a distinct taste that I don’t find tolerable. Unfortunately I’ll be trying GenePro instead.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Watson

customer_reviews.title: I Wanted A Non-Milky Protein
customer_reviews.text: I bought this under the impression it was going to be like nothing when mixed with water. I was wrong. This basically turns water into a funky milk texture with no taste. It's probably good in smoothies, but I hate the milky, not mixing easily protein powders and this is one of them imo. I'd rather just drink their Isopure Gatorade type drink instead.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best and only unflavored protein powder I will ever buy,and honestly I bought it as an accident but was pleasantly suprised,and am now buying to try the tahitian vanilla and dark chocolate flavors. This stuff is very expensive compared to what everyone else has to offer,but i think its probably the best stuff on the market right now
customer_reviews.author: Donald e Messinger

customer_reviews.title: Will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this five stars because it is exactly what it says. Unflavored and sugar free. Being on a keto diet, even though its moderate protein, there are just some things you still want. Protein powder gives me the option to make alot of bread like products. I dont make these alot, but when I do it's great to have a base like this that only adds what I need and nothing extra.
customer_reviews.author: KingCjn

customer_reviews.title: Good but becoming expensive
customer_reviews.text: I really like everything about this protein. Unfortunately I will not buy it anymore because its price keep moving up more than the competition. Funny, it is the same reason why I switch long ago from my favorite protein to this one when it was a lot less expensive
customer_reviews.author: Moonear

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy the taste of milk/dairy, GET IT. Otherwise... still get it.
customer_reviews.text: Just take my word for it: buy it. Only speaking on the unflavored one here, of course... if you ever needed a taste-reminder that whey is a straight derivative of milk, this is it. If you mix it with water, it'll taste like watered-down (fat-free?) milk. If you mix it with milk, it'll taste... milkier (not necessarily "creamier", but milkier). All this with none of the chemical/artificial aftertastes that you get with most other "flavored" varieties/brands. I'm just now discovering this (after forcing down Optimum's French Vanilla powder for almost a decade now), and I really wish I could go back in time... For those of you who don't care for the straight taste of dairy, cook/bake with the powder!
customer_reviews.author: osamiam

customer_reviews.title: It is what it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it says it is. No additives. That's a peaceful feeling knowing I'm not ingesting chemicals in my smoothie. It tastes pretty bland compared to the others, but you can add your own flavor. Doesn't dissolve when just stirred with a spoon. Need a blender. Too pricey. Won't be able to purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Earrings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely flavorless if you just added to regular milk, you’ll taste a little bit of the general whey protein flavor to it; however when added with flavorful things it does like to foam up a bit and will separate if not drank almost automatically or shaken before drinking. Nevertheless I am a very big fan, I do hate flavored protein because they are always too sweet for me.
customer_reviews.author: NateP93

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: This protein powder does taste quite funny with water, well maybe not the taste, but the texture is kind of weird and it might make you gag if you drink the bubbles at the very end, but this only applies to water though. I always need to drink almond milk every morning to get my daily supply of calcium without that gross lactose, and this shake goes perfectly well with my almond milk. It's very easy to drink and I don't get all bloated like I do with non-isolate protein powders.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great for adding a little more protein to your diet
customer_reviews.text: The benefit of having an unflavored protein is it allows you to mix it in with countless amount of foods to help give a protein gram count boost. I use it frequently for smoothies with fruits, yogurt and other ingredients. it doesn't change any of the taste (only makes the drink a little thicker). Would highly recommend if you are looking for a good protein add in
customer_reviews.author: photographyee

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get protein without a constant flavour.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. Used in fruit smoothies when i didn't want a flavour to overpower the fruit flavours. Also used it in banana protein pancakes. I will buy again and recommend. I get bored of flavoured protein powder as is very repetitive. This is a nice change up.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Not for anyone sensitive to smells.
customer_reviews.text: Tastes fine and mixed well into my drink, but I won't be purchasing this item again. I found the smell to be repulsive. My husband said it was comparable to calf formula.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 scoop please
customer_reviews.text: I really like this protein powder. It comes with a scoop. Depending on what you mix it with you may notice a taste reminiscent of milk. For example, tea and coffee tend to bring out a milk like essence. If I mix it in smoothies or with other foods, I do not notice any taste. Twenty grams of healthy protein in a scoop... hard to beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Floridian

customer_reviews.title: easy to mix, good taste (or rather lack thereof)
customer_reviews.text: The product has a slight "milky" smell, but is, as advertised, unflavored which I really like. No artificial flavors or exaggerated sweetness, just pure protein. I added a banana and a handful of blueberries to some milk, and the resulting was a perfectly smooth and tasty protein drink. Very satisfying!
customer_reviews.author: Johan Bollen

customer_reviews.title: Must mix in a blender and with almond milk
customer_reviews.text: Can not just mix with water, taste is not good. (Even tried adding a crystal light) Doesn't mix well in just a cup/shaker. Mixes well in a blender and tastes fine with vanilla almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L

customer_reviews.title: No nasty taste actually no taste at all (thank goodness)
customer_reviews.text: Recently brought and made shakes with for work and pretty much to loose the baby tummy from two kids lol.... i am a foodie and this really helps!!! The morning i usually would get eggs pancakes etc (yes heavy food lol ) but i mixed this with my shakes and it suppressed my appetite.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Nikkii

product_meta.title: Isopure Zero Carb Unflavored 25g Protein, 100% Whey Protein Isolate, Keto Friendly Protein Powder, No Added Colors/Flavors/Sweeteners, GMO Free, 1 Pound (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Flavor:Unflavored| Size:1 Pound (Pack of 1)Isopure Unflavored WPI powder contains 25 grams per serving of 100% Whey Protein Isolate, stripped of fat, carbs, fillers, sugars and lactose. Easy to add to any food and beverage (hot or cold), and so pure you won't even taste it. Isopure Whey Protein Isolate has 5.67 g of naturally occurring BCAA's in every serving and is Lactose and Gluten Free. It also has 2.57 grams of naturally occurring L-Glutamine in every serving. There are no additives just pure, naked protein. The microfiltration process used to create Isopure is so complete that it is the only completely clear milk protein when it is dissolved in water.
feature_bullets: Cook, Bake, Blend with Unflavored Protein Powder
Pure, Unflavored, GMO Free, 100% WHEY PROTEIN ISOLATE - a high-quality protein source providing 25g per serving to support muscle building and recovery
The easy way to add high-quality protein into your preferred flavored beverages (hot or cold), smoothies, soups, sauces and baked goods recipes.
Keto friendly - this protein powder can help support your ketogenic macros

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
